page.title: 19LONGSIGHT FARM, HULL
page.content: Longsight Farm belongs to Trinity House and is 270 years old. {CATTLE They only keep cows and bulls but they are the very special Simnn and Charolais breeds.Simnn and Charolais are the best cattle for breeding beef because they get more profit.They try to sell them for Â£400 to Â£500 each. In winter they are kept inside and get supplementary fed. {CROPS There are 470 acres of land.On it are 70 acres of oil,102 acres of winter barley and 120 acres of grass.The crops are sold in Hull near Drypool Bridge.They plant their crops in Sept-Oct and take them out in Summer.{ {MACHINERY They have 4 tractors which belongs to Trinity House except 1.They also have a combine harvester.
